title: What is test for oxygen and hydrogen? - Quora

response.answer_text: Oxygen gas rekindles the glowing splint as it bursts into flames. It is absorbed in alkaline pyrogallol solution and solution turns dark brown. Hydrogen gas burns with a ‘pop’ sound and extinguishes the lighted splint. Hydrogen gas has no colour or smell. Hydrogen gas has no effect on moist litmus paper paper as it is neutral. It burns with a characteristic 'pop”(sound of a small explosion)and hydrogen gas is highly flammable. 2 pyrogallol + O2 ⟶ 2 o-quinone+2H2O v�0�=�

A lighted wooden splint goes out in a test tube of carbon dioxide but this happens with other gases, too. It is better to bubble the test gas through limewater - calcium hydroxide solution. Carbon dioxide turns limewater cloudy white.
